ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour
A fair amount of work, very manageable.
30 minutes
5 hours
2 hours
.5 for homework1-2 for reading

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: strength - lots of insight and interesting information that probably would not have been taught if it had not been from a professor that has so much experience in the areano weakness
Course is not very structured. Many Presenters use the same slides over and over. Sometimes stories can be interesting but most of the time the class is dry.
Strength: a new insight from the industry, different from academic research.
Great course, that provides a lot of information not given in other classes.
Great professor. Could have done without the expensive textbook.
It's good that we had many guest lecturers from the industry

This course was interesting. Dr. Makuch provides a lot of first hand experience. Some of the material is dense, which makes it hard to follow at times. Otherwise very useful informationmy favorite aspect of the course was having the opportunity to hear guest speakers. They were all very impressive individuals with a lot of experience in the field.

It was really nice to have guest speakers; some are very knowledgeable and well-known in the field of regulatory affairs.The class is very laid-back. The workload was minimum, which was a plus for second years who were busy doing their thesis.I didn't feel like learning much from this class. Some of the information was mentioned multiple times.Most students showed no interest in the subject. They were too busy working on their computer during most of the class session. No one seemed to know anything when the professor or the guest speaker asked a question.
useful

I love the fact that this class is very useful and applicable for students interested in the pharmaceutical and medical device industry. The professor uses current news as cases in point to keep us updated on what is going on in the field. DIA is a great resource he suggested to us too. Also, I love all his speaker lectures.
focus on the content. loose at the assignments. these are the good choices because the fda is not supposed to be taught like a hard science.

The professor of this class was clearly knowledgeable and friendly, but the course was not structured well. The tests focused on miniscule details rather than big or general points, which I think is key for a intro to regulatory affairs class.
Very good intro to regulatory affairs. Insightful guest speakers.
Great experience.Interesting stories and useful knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Robert Makuch  great I really like him a lot.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  The lecture would be better with more preparation.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  He's very knowledgeable in the field, and is fair to students. Great professor.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Excellent
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Very knowledgeable

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch is extremely friendly and passionate about the subject matter. He brings a lot of first hand experience to the class, which really helps people understand the application of the material.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  He is very passionate about regulatory affairs. Unfortunately, not many students share the same level of enthusiasm as he does.He is a good talker, but somewhat scatter-minded, also very approachable and really want the students to learn the material.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  great teacher

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Dr. Makuch is very passionate about this course and is very knowledgable in this area. It was very interesting to hear about his personal experiences in the field of Regulatory Affairs.

Instructor: Robert Makuch  Bob is awesome! My favorite professor at YSPH! He is very approachable, helpful and has great connections with the industry as well as regulatory bodies domestically and internationally.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  a good and knowledgeable instructor. but the communication with students should be better. he should open more office hour and not missing so many emails from students.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Great instructor; cared about his students.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Great professor - knowledgeable and cares about the topic and his students.
Instructor: Robert Makuch  Interesting and helpful.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Will is great..on time, always courteous and responsive
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  He could communicate more often with the students and be more responsive to emails.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Helpful.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  He's a great TA.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Great
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  -Responsive to emails and questions.-Grades assignments in a timely manner.-Easy to talk with regarding class subjects.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Very responsible
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  William was extremely responsive to any questions about the course or homework.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Will is a very good TA.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  A responsible and approachable TA; a diligent worker
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  helpful
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Very helpful. Took a lot of time to provide feedback on our homework assignments.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Our TA is very responsive and always replies my email right away, great to have a nice TA like Will.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  good.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Will was quick to answer emails and help when needed.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  good, very responsible
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Great with feedback and homework comments. Responsive and helpful.
Instructor: William Kenji Murk  Very helpful and responsible.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: About what the FDA does and gives real life examples of it

I would not recommend this class to those outside of regulatory affairs track. Also, even for those in the track, regulatory affairs by nature is not best taught in classroom. Those who are interested probably should learn from actual work experience.
Course material is interesting. A lot of self-learning.
Great class, highly recommended.
Makuch is great, take this class.
Useful and interesting
I would recommend this course to another student. While the material can be a little dense, it definitely gives you the opportunity to learn a lot about pharmaceuticals and the FDA.
It is an easy class. The material is not for everyone, but definitely a nice exposure to the regulatory affair world.
yes

This course is a great opportunity to learn about a field that you are not really exposed to in other coures at YSPH. I would recommend that a student interested in regulatory affairs take this course.

This course is a primer for regulatory affairs track. It introducesbasic topics and knowledge about the FDA, EMA and SFDA. You will also gain a lot from the speaker lectures. A highly recommended course!
yes. you can learn what you expect to learn about regulatory affairs.
Good course if you're interested in learning more about the FDA regulatory affairs world. If you took Clinical Trials don't expect the same exam format!
All the things about regulatory affairs.Recommend. It's both interesting and useful.
This course is full of important information, although it is presented extremely dryly.
